DOC.brief_summary: Multicenter , double-blind , control , parallel group , randomize study compare clinical benefit Estradiol acetate tablet , estradiol tablet conjugate equine estrogen tablet , administer orally , daily , postmenopausal woman .
DOC.brief_title: Hormone Replacement Therapy Use Postmenopausal Women Relief Hot Flushes Urogenital Symptoms .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age ≥ 40 year age ; bilateral oophorectomy ≥ 35 year age . 2 . Nonhysterectomized woman : Amenorrhea ≥ 12 month Amenorrhea ≤ 12 month , longer 6 month , serum FSH ( follicle stimulate hormone ) level > 40 units/L serum estradiol level < 20 pg /mL , Hysterectomized woman : Bilateral oophorectomy subject may enter study 6 week surgery History removal ovary may confirm serum FSH level > 40 units/L serum estradiol level < 20 pg/mL via surgical report / ultrasound . 3 . Seven moderate severe hot flush daily 1 week 60 moderate severe flush 1 week 2 week screening period prior study entry . 1 . Hormone therapy administer via follow route specify timeframes : oral within 8 week , vaginal ( ring , cream , gel ) within 1 week , transdermal within 4 week , intramuscular within 6 week , progestational implant , estrogen estrogen/progestational injectable drug therapy within 3 month , estrogen pellet progestational injectable within 6 month . 2 . Abnormal Pap smear suggestive low grade squamous intraepithelial lesion ( LGSIL ) bad . Enrollment subject ASCUS ( atypical squamous cell undetermined significance ) interpretation must discuss sponsor prior randomization . 3 . Urinary tract infection 4 . Congestive heart failure 5 . Uncontrolled hypertension ; sit systolic BP ≥ 160 mmHg diastolic ≥ 95 mmHg 6 . History stroke transient ischemic attack 7 . Treatment anticoagulant ( heparin warfarin ) . 8 . Uncontrolled thyroid disorder . 9 . Insulindependent diabetes mellitus . 10 . Increase frequency severity headache include migraine previous estrogen therapy .
